intro: Zehneria peneyana, commonly known as the white zehneria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub with opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a distinctive spurred petal. Zehneria peneyana is appreciated in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
